intro: Saxifraga decipiens var. arkwrightii, commonly known as the rock saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of southern Africa. It features dense clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to retain moisture in harsh environments. It thrives in rocky soils and full sun, often found in mountainous and arid habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
